column1: I was honored to receive the 2019 Wheat Advocate Award from the National Association of Wheat Growers & I’m proud to lend my continued support to the hardworking wheat growers who contribute tremendously to the agriculture industry. https://t.co/ixB1MefhMg
Hopefully cooler heads will prevail before the further use of force provided that it's in consultation w/ Congress. Read my full statement on the Iran War Powers Res. here: https://t.co/RaYJ0XMtDI

While the Pres. has a duty to protect Americans from threats by using military force when necessary using it w/o a threat or Congressional approval is not only reckless it is a violation of the Constitution.

If there's one thing I know about Congressman Lewis it’s that he's a fighter. Though I'm deeply saddened by this news it's his fighting spirit that gives me hope. My wife Vivian & I will keep him in our prayers as he undergoes cancer treatment & continues making ‘good trouble.'

I am pleased to support the final version of the USMCA. Americans everywhere will benefit from the new provisions that protect American workers and provide for more equitable trade between the three countries. https://t.co/Sp6aiMc2oN

Pres. & Mrs. Carter had an impact in GA the nation & the world. With this bill visitors will come to Plains & be inspired to serve & make a difference. I’m proud to stand w/ the GA delegation to ensure his legacy is preserved for generations to come. https://t.co/ftGFO8k2pa

There's no joy for me in the impeachment process. Unfortunately based on his words conduct & the evidence there's no option but to impeach. The President & MoCs take an oath to the Constitution. The President violated his oath but I won't violate mine https://t.co/ytvpX9YCel
To read my full statement follow this link: https://t.co/8oE6QU8ctB

The two minibuses we passed comprise all 12 FY 2020 funding bills & reflect our American values. I’m very pleased w/ the final results of bipartisan/bicameral negotiations & I’m hopeful the Senate & President will move quickly to make these minibuses into law before Friday.

As our country becomes increasingly diverse and the number of students at #MSIs and #HBCUs continues to increase Congress has a responsibility to support these institutions. That’s why we voted to PERMANENTLY reauthorize funding for our nation’s HBCUs and MSIs. #ForTheFUTURE

I’m delighted to hear that @SWGAUnited received approx. $1.5M in Youthbuild Grants from @USDOL & I'm proud of all of the hard work they've done to prepare the next generation of leaders for economic success through their exemplary workforce development program.

The U.S. Census Bureau is hiring Census Takers to work in their own communities. You can make a difference help your community and earn extra income for doing it. Apply online at https://t.co/eu4fIazzxx. #ApplyToday #2020CensusJobs

The current prices of prescription drugs for Americans are outrageous. Americans shouldn't be held hostage by companies for life-saving meds & I'm proud to support legislation that'll help citizens get the meds they need to live. https://t.co/clT4fGTvfF

I’m pleased w/ the final conference report on the NDAA. Most of the priorities we pushed in the House were agreed to in the Senate. This NDAA is the most robust defense budget in history. https://t.co/lrMooTyurc

It also reforms the H-2A temp ag worker program to provide flexibility for employers & protections for workers. Several issues need to be worked out with the Senate but this is a good 1st step. https://t.co/XGZFClHE4R 2/2

American ag has a labor crisis. U.S. workers stopped working in ag jobs & farmers became dependent on foreign workers to keep their farms running and operating. H.R. 5038 requires applicants to undergo background checks & pass criminal/ntl sec bars. 1/2

The #FUTUREAct improves the self-sufficiency of #HBCUs and #MSIs while strengthening their ability to serve low-income students. With bipartisan and bicameral support I am confident in Congress’ ability to protect these institutions and reauthorize vital funding #ForTheFUTURE.
Wishing you all a safe and happy holiday season! https://t.co/HCh1HdLRwF

Congratulations to the Americus Police Dept. for receiving their national accreditation from the Commission on Accreditation for Law Enforcement Agencies (@CALEA_org) & thank you for your dedication to upholding the highest standards of law enforcement & public safety.

This rule only serves to punish our most vulnerable citizens & during the holiday season adds insult to injury. Instead of helping these Americans the Administration has decided to disparage them as lazy & undeserving. #HandsOffSNAP https://t.co/E8QCZyGQ1s

ATTENTION SENIORS: Medicare open enrollment period ends on December 7. Please take advantage of free federal and state resources like Medicare Plan Finder & GeorgiaCares to find SAVINGS ON HEALTH INSURANCE PLANS AND PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION.

This CR will help w/ funding for the census & a 3.1% pay raise for service members. I support this CR & supported the last one & I urge the Senate to pass the approps bills forthwith & get them to the Pres. to prevent another govt shutdown. https://t.co/NxQCD6XFK5

Yesterday I joined my CBC colleagues in sending a letter to @SecretarySonny addressing our concerns about @USDA’s proposed rule to eliminate broad-based categorical eligibility in SNAP and the detrimental effects this rule may have. https://t.co/IufiVjqKMX

As we continue to celebrate #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth let us also take the time to reflect and honor the significant history accomplishments and customs surrounding Native American communities and culture. https://t.co/7vFNwUhVSN

I was humbled to present the Inaugural Medal of Bravery posthumously to Stormy one of the first Marine Scout Dog teams to be deployed to Vietnam. Military canines are more important than ever in keeping our service members safe. Thank you for your service Stormy. #militarydog https://t.co/s5KU7GWOAz

Today @usdaRMA announced it will continue to defer accrual of interest for 2019 crop year insurance premiums to help the wide swath of farmers and ranchers affected by extreme weather in 2019. https://t.co/ArZYi9FUbj
I’m proud to join my colleagues in this bipartisan and bicameral letter urging @USFWS to protect the livelihoods of agricultural producers from avian predators. https://t.co/TgRgGrufbw

I'm saddened to hear Rep. Conyers passed away. He was a champion for racial equality & changed Congress by co-founding the CBC. He was a powerful & effective legislator who never stopped fighting to improve our nation.  https://t.co/O7BSCFYq2t

I'm sorry to hear that my longtime mentor & friend Sen. Leroy Johnson passed away. He was an inspiration to me and he motivated me to emulate his path to public service. I extend my sincere condolences to his family & all those who mourn the loss of this great trailblazer.

I'm saddened by the passing of my longtime friend & colleague Elijah E. Cummings. America has lost a warrior who was committed to doing the right thing regardless of politics. Vivian & I send our prayers & deepest condolences to his family & loved ones. https://t.co/7iJuDYVj3w
Medicare Open Enrollment has begun and only lasts for six weeks – October 15 to December 7. Don’t miss your chance to #GetCovered on https://t.co/f7M4gQT116 for 2020!

House-passed spending legislation invests in school lunch and breakfast programs to ensure our children have access to healthy nutritious food. Tune in at 10 AM as @AppropsDems & I protect these vital programs. #WorldFoodDay https://t.co/IiZ12Amiab

Chairwoman @NitaLowey has been a leader & trailblazer in her 31 yrs in Congress as the 1st Chairwoman of the Approps Committee & I'll always cherish our friendship. She's earned retirement & I wish her the best! https://t.co/FvotbDgvw9
I enjoyed reading to the Pre-K classes at The Growing Room & celebrating the importance of quality early learning programs during #GaPreKWeek https://t.co/L7BhQ5mkf6

Starting October 1 2020 Americans flying within the U.S. will need to have a REAL ID driver’s license or another accepted form of ID. GA licenses issued since July 2012 are already REAL IDs. For more information about REAL ID visit https://t.co/nYoXTMuTF9. https://t.co/PIZsH9yt4J

Breaking News: @cathymcmorris & I will host the annual Military Family Summit on next Wednesday 10/09! #milfam   More Info: https://t.co/3N2IyuLz2u    Registration: https://t.co/XEPHcwyWQO https://t.co/woGP2uR15f

Members of Congress took an oath before God to uphold the Constitution not to the President. It is imperative to our national security the preservation of the rule of law and our patriotism that we begin an impeachment inquiry. https://t.co/KmJ9C1wpqm

Substance use & mental health disorders don’t discriminate. These issues affect us all which is why we must work together to support those in recovery. I’m proud to support #NationalRecoveryMonth today with my colleagues in Congress. https://t.co/rtrFUHwZkT

This CR is vital to ensure Americans aren't hurt by a gov shutdown. Americans shouldn’t have to pay the price when Congress can’t agree on funding. While I support the CR I urge the Senate to pass the House-passed approps bills & get them to the President.https://t.co/CQgGZg3ZzX
Breaking News: @cathymcmorris & I will host the annual Military Family Summit on 10/09! #milfam   More Info: https://t.co/3N2IyuLz2u    Registration: https://t.co/XEPHcwyWQO https://t.co/NLxSGDnGcN

Last week the world lost a true icon civil rights activist and visionary Mrs. Juanita Abernathy. May she rest in peace & may her tremendous contributions to the Civil Rights Movement be remembered for years to come.

My office is still accepting US service academy nomination applications. I highly encourage the bright & motivated students from Georgia's Second Congressional District to pursue this life-changing opportunity to serve their community & their nation. https://t.co/jH5VPG5Xxg

Our country was changed by the 9/11 terrorist attacks. The world stopped as the attacks unfolded & thousands lost their lives. I continue to hold the victims families survivors & first responders in my heart as we move through this difficult day. We won’t ever forget.

The Transatlantic Slave Trade was the largest coerced migration of human beings in the history of the world. An estimated 10 million to 12 million enslaved Africans were transported across the Atlantic Ocean to the Americas between the 16th to the 19th Century.  #400YearsLater https://t.co/NgVUlGRPP7

It's been a long road to get the disaster relief Mid/SW Georgians need since Hurricane Michael ripped through GA02 in Oct.'18. Thanks to @SecretarySonny/@USDA Americans across the nation/territories will finally have the aid needed to rebuild/move forward. https://t.co/179jA5p62A

I recently met with Major General Gary M. Brito Commanding General of the U.S. Army Maneuver Center of Excellence to discuss the ongoing improvements to military housing at Fort Benning Georgia. https://t.co/9AQBoFLbSS
On the 54th Anniversary of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 it is vital that we continue to protect the right of all Americans to vote and participate in our democracy. https://t.co/QHtYzTqbPa

The Bipartisan Budget Act contains acceptable budget caps & suspends the debt limit so we can engage in a disciplined appropriations process invest in our country & grow the economy—while protecting the full faith & credit of the US. https://t.co/bSbyGSvCP1

I joined my fellow MFC co-chair @CathyMcMorris in addressing education for military children. I firmly believe that giving every child the same opportunity to reach their full potential will strengthen our military improve our retention rates & benefit our entire nation. https://t.co/iJG42QXK4r
Thanks to a debris removal reimbursement grant from @fema the City of Albany can fully focus on repairing & rebuilding areas impacted by Hurricane Michael. https://t.co/FHFHSYQMLs

I’ve long supported American workers & was proud to support the #RaiseTheWageAct! This bill will give 43% of GA02 workers a major raise and stimulate the local economy. Americans work hard & should be able to support themselves & their families.  https://t.co/fOmurVjDot

I am extremely pleased with the FY2020 NDAA. This bill cements a robust national defense while strengthening our commitment to support our troops in every way possible. I am positive that this will keep our military the best in the world. https://t.co/DHZLLtiFwQ

This week as we remember the devastating flood of 1994 that took 31 lives evacuated 40000+ people & destroyed communities let us also remember the generosity & kindness our neighbors showed one another & keep that spirit alive as we honor those we lost 25 years ago. https://t.co/FePNhKKlyO
Wishing a safe and happy Fourth of July to all! Happy #IndependenceDay! https://t.co/lIOex8FzLF

OTD in 1964 the Civil Rights Act was signed into law by Pres. LBJ. This monumental legislation prohibited segregation in public places & discrimination based on race color religion sex or national origin. Fifty-five years later the fight for equality continues. https://t.co/ZIkBtXkCfU

The current treatment of migrant children & fams @ our border is unacceptable & inconsistent w/ our nation’s values. While the bill doesn’t satisfy everyone I’m relieved that we came to a bipartisan consensus that is more reflective of American values. https://t.co/YCoSWrTMwD

I’m proud to support the 2nd bipartisan approps bill which makes investments in our military fams vets rural communities ag public safety infrastructure clean air & drinking water as well as other areas. I hope it will quickly pass in the Senate. https://t.co/mrPj8WM4Ve

The #VotingRightsAct of 1965 was a landmark law that prohibited racial discrimination in voting. Forty-eight yrs later a portion of the act was ruled unconstitutional leading to purged voter rolls shortened early voting periods & almost a thousand closures of polling places. https://t.co/ohzTn6rBE4
Today we recommit ourselves to working to free modern-day slaves around the world and honoring the efforts of those who fought so hard to steer our country to our highest ideals. #Juneteenth
Today marks 244 years of American soldiers defending the freedoms of our great nation. Happy Birthday to the oldest and largest of our Armed Forces the @USArmy! #Hooah #ArmyBday

Earlier this week I humbly accepted the Visionary Award from @fightblindness for introducing the Eye Bonds bill. There is so much promising research on treatments for blindness but it sits on shelves because there isn’t money to advance it. More info https://t.co/7MgnfuslgR https://t.co/NdJHii8xAj

I look forward to @SecretarySonny & @USDA   distributing the disaster bill assistance to rural communities and farmers so SW GA and the nation can get relief as soon as possible. https://t.co/Ieo0TY2dMy

As Chair of the AG-RD-FDA Approps Subcommittee I am extremely proud that our bill invests in America’s fundamental needs & rejects the Administration’s radical cuts. READ MORE HERE ->  https://t.co/1we8giiddQ

WATCH NOW as I lead the @AppropsDems’ markup for the FY 2020 AG-RD-FDA approps bill which provides $24.3 billion in funding an increase of $1 billion for food & nutrition programs rural development medical product safety & much more. https://t.co/ytfKFx0dYR https://t.co/qzmk05TZQL

I am proud to announce that H.R. 2157 has passed the House and is on its way to @POTUS’ desk. I am thankful that Americans will finally receive disaster relief after months of waiting for the Administration and the Senate to stop playing politics.

I extend my sincerest condolences to the family of Fmr. MS Sen. Thad Cochran. He was a true patriot whose significant contributions to agriculture & his state were well documented during his time in Congress through his roles as Chair of the Sen. Approps & Ag Committees.

Once again Republicans have found a way to prolong the suffering of millions of Americans by blocking H.R. 2157. This disaster relief is vital to the livelihoods of millions and should not be used as a political pawn.

It’s disheartening to hear that the expected disaster relief that was on its way to @POTUS’ desk has been delayed yet again. However I am hopeful that the House will pass this vital piece of legislation next week!

I applaud the Senate for finally passing H.R. 2157! I look forward to the House passing & @POTUS signing this essential bill to provide much-needed relief for all those directly affected by Hurricane Michael and other natural disasters across the country.

As Chairman of the Ag-RD-FDA Approps Subcommittee I'm proud we approved our 1st bill which rejects the Administration’s drastic cuts & provides funding to ensure access to affordable food medicine & medical devices & vital infrastructure in rural communities. https://t.co/ZrYEkCM5p5
HAPPENING NOW w/ @AppropsDems: My first mark up as Chairman of the Agriculture-Rural Development-FDA Appropriations Subcommittee of our FY2020 funding bill. Watch here: https://t.co/zXlaETeMB7

I’m pleased to support H.R. 987 which would strengthen the ACA & ensure that all Americans - especially those w/ pre-existing conditions - receive outstanding health care benefits. https://t.co/98tVJxPigo

At a time when federal investment in infrastructure has been shrinking the need for investment could not be more apparent. Our nation’s infrastructure is crumbling and we can’t wait another day to act. #InfrastructureWeek https://t.co/a3qqstFGTp

I am pleased to hear that the House passed H.R. 299 the Blue Water Navy Vietnam Veterans Act of 2019 and that the Veterans who sacrificed their lives on behalf of America’s freedom will no longer be denied the benefits they so rightfully deserve.

Extending my deepest condolences to the loved ones of Alice Rivlin the 1st woman to oversee @USCBO @OMB & serve as VP of the @federalreserve. She was a dedicated public servant & true advocate for bipartisan fiscal policy.  #HERstory
Sending my best wishes and prayers to my good friend former President Jimmy Carter as he continues to recover from his hip surgery. #GetWellSoon

I would like to extend my deepest condolences to the family friends and loved ones of Mr. Terry Lewis from the @Albany_Herald. He was a gifted reporter who touched countless lives through his writing.

As a proud Eagle Scout I would like to wish @boyscouts a Happy 109th Birthday! The valuable skills traditions & principles that you have instilled in your members have helped prepare them for what lies ahead & makes them better leaders for tomorrow.
